query: When C is placed along the edge of B and A is poured on B, what changes will occur on B after a period of time?

original_scene.description: A is water in a metal container. B is an upside-down plate. C is a cup of rainbow beans.

key_step_1.conclusion: C is placed along the edge of B. C contains pigments

key_step_2.conclusion: When A and C come into contact, the pigment in C will dissolve into A, and the density of the dissolved liquid will be greater than that of A.

key_step_3.conclusion: Since the density of the dissolved liquid is greater than that of A, and C is arranged along the edge of B, the dissolved liquid with higher density will move together to the center with lower density.

final_scene.annotation: The pigment in C dissolves in A and creates a rainbow pattern on B.

subject: mechanics
